title: Living with Yourself, Netflix, review: double Paul Rudd makes for a fun clone comedy
text:
The very first shot of Living with Yourself (Netflix) is of Hollywood heartthrob and Marvel superhero Paul Rudd clawing his way out of a shallow grave. He heaves for breath, wrapped in transparent plastic and wearing nothing but a nappy. Netflix tempting Rudd to an unknown project by a largely unknown creator for his first leading role in a TV series may be quite the coup, but they’re certainly not giving him an easy ride.

As well as having to recreate many people’s worst nightmare, Rudd also has double the workload. In this eight-part comedy-drama-with-a-dash-of-sci-fi, he’s starring opposite himself as advertising executive Miles and the clone that becomes the unexpected side effect of a seemingly...
description: The very first shot of Living with Yourself (Netflix) is of Hollywood heartthrob and Marvel superhero Paul Rudd clawing his way out of a shallow grave.
